website_summaries.verdict: Soothing ingredients like chamomile calm babies, and probiotics keep their digestive systems healthy.
pros: Culturelle is a well-known brand for probiotics
Quality and trusted source as recommended by pediatricians

The Calm + Comfort drops are formulated specifically for babies up to 12 months old with the specific number of CFUs (colony forming units, or properly active bacteria) present in the recommended dose
cons: Some parents reported difficulty measuring the dosage using the included dropper

customer_reviews.title: Causes baby poop to become weaponized.
customer_reviews.text: This made our baby poop in such quantities and textures that it made me reevaluate my understanding of Science and Reason. The smells will haunt my dreams and have condemned my home to the ashes. Chernobyl has nothing on my baby's rectum after the assault of this toxic waste producing goo. One star, do not recommend. Going back to Mama Bliss Probiotics, which never left me scarred and huddled in the corner weeping for the sweet sweet release of death.
customer_reviews.author: moo4u152

customer_reviews.title: Poorly designed dropper makes product difficult to use
customer_reviews.text: These probiotics are the worst. The dropper is poorly designed and make it so you wind up giving your little one way more probiotic than they need. The bottle is supposed to last 30 days, but I went through it in a week and a half. It would be better if the company included a syringe and told you how much in milliliters to give your child.
customer_reviews.author: Abigailp

customer_reviews.title: LOOK AT THE INGREDIENTS !!!
customer_reviews.text: I do not like the ingredients of this item. I have been giving it to my babybuntil one day I finally had the time to research and I was very dissapointed. Why would they use bad infridients in baby probiotics !! And it is NOT CHEAP!!
customer_reviews.author: Elena K

customer_reviews.title: We were using mommy's bliss probiotics but I liked that this one combines the vitamin d too
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could give it zero stars. My baby has a lot of gas and stomach pains. We were using mommy's bliss probiotics but I liked that this one combines the vitamin d too. After trying this, it makes my baby cry violently for hours and hours. It does the exact opposite of what it is supposed to do. I have no idea how this product has good reviews. Go with another probiotic option! It's not worth the additional crying and discomfort for your baby.
customer_reviews.author: Jbryant

customer_reviews.title: GREAT/HELPFUL PRODUCT!!
customer_reviews.text: Buy this right now! My 11 week old has had colic, lots of gas (way more than my first born), and bad reflux since he was 2 weeks old. I wish I would have known about this product earlier. It has helped his colic, but more than that it’s helped him to be able to use the restroom! His gassiness has gotten a lot better too!! I didn’t know I was running low, so I didn’t have it for a couple of days. I immediately noticed a difference!! He was extra gassy and was constipated. As soon as it came in the mail, a day later he was better! Definitely worth the money, because it is a little pricey.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: My baby’s  tummy troubles are gone !
customer_reviews.text: Initially I tried culturell brand as my pediatrician suggested powder form of this brand and my baby doesn’t consume the powder form fully.After seeing this new product in amazon was happy that culturell released the baby probiotics. It’s a really a good product than other brand .Tried Gerber probiotics drops before but it doesn’t overcome my baby’s tummy trouble .After giving this one he is doing good and his tummy troubles are gone .He is having a nice sleep at Night and the baby’s diarrhea also gone and he pooped good Not like watery before .Suggesting this one to other friends .
customer_reviews.author: AP

customer_reviews.title: #1 Pediatrician recommended brand gives us confidence
customer_reviews.text: This is a great idea and delivers a proactive and supportive approach to digestive health through probiotics. Glad we can deliver that in a safe and effective way. We gave this as a gift and fun to see a happy and healthy baby on Super Bowl weekend.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer Since 2002

customer_reviews.title: Love this product, but I’m Reconsidering buying online..
customer_reviews.text: I’ve purchased these packets a few times on Amazon and every time I get a few that are compromised or are hard as rocks. Is there a way for the manufacturers to do a better job of evaluating these packets? I love this product, my daughter has to take a probiotic on a daily basis and I feel like I’m throwing money down the drain by having to throw out these packets and purchase another box. I’m hoping the company gets this, because I love the product, I just think it’s wasteful and I’m disappointed that this is probably the fourth time this has happened.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Less gassy and less poop
customer_reviews.text: My 2nd child who is 6 weeks old was having tummy issues. He’s exclusively breastfed. He was very gassy, and pooping every hour, no joke, 12-20 poops a day. His pediatrician recommended starting him on probiotics. I’m so glad I bought this, within 4 days we noticed a huge difference, he’s no longer as uncomfortable and poops half as much as before. He’s less gassy too which helps him nap longer and we all know how precious nap time is. Highly recommend and love that this also has vitamin d.
customer_reviews.author: Jen D

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: Dropper is hard to use and makes for inaccurate dosing. The drops are also dark brown and thick - not sure if this is how they're supposed be. Product seems to be making my baby's digestive issues worse and it's potentially causing diarrhea. His BM have not been the same since I gave this to him. :-( Anticipating getting a refund, but almost not worth all the time and effort. Wish I would have just stuck with my former (slightly more expensive brand).
customer_reviews.author: Chicco

customer_reviews.title: Overall seemed ok will not purchase again
customer_reviews.text: Overall seemed like an ok product. Personally my baby did not like the taste & tended to spit it back out if given directly so i added it to a bottle. They need to change the bottle/dropper design. It's pretty impossible to measure five single drops into her mouth without missing- easier to add to a bottle if your not breastfeeding but still sometimes she didn't finish the whole bottle & id wonder how much she actually got. Did not see any improvement in how often she threw up or how often she was fussy. Plus it could be coincidence but she actually tended to throw up more of the bottle after the drops than the bottles without-
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa S.

customer_reviews.title: Not suitable for newborns
customer_reviews.text: Packet was scratched and torn. Probiotic was dense liquid of dark yellow color and suspended granules. Granules didn't mix in milk and resulted in my infant vomitting everytime - right after the feed. Bad quality product.. Amazon needs to maintain shipment temperature to ensure medicinal value!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Received an open used bottle
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to get my little one started on these since he suffers with gas. When I received these the box was a little crushed but still closed. However when I opened the box the bottle of probiotics had been opened and half was gone. That's when I examined the box and the bottom seemed to have glue on it. I contacted Amazon about this. I really hope no one tampered with this product for babies.
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina S.

customer_reviews.title: didn't work, almost worse and the dropper is ridiculous
customer_reviews.text: It made my baby's gas/colic even worse, thought gas was passing through she was screaming in pain. the crying was much worse and we got even less sleep than before, i experimented and on the days we did not take this, the crying/discomfort wasn't as intense. Then restarted and misery again. And the silly dropper, can't they think of something so simple, their product is a sticky gooey mess and for tiny infants who are howling already- how can i measure 5 drops when the liquid is so inconsistent. pretty sure she got more than needed. plus it looks GROSS
customer_reviews.author: B.Su

customer_reviews.title: Really terrible for my constipated baby
customer_reviews.text: Our baby has been extremely constipated despite a diet of almost all greens, prune and pear juice and lots of breastmilk. I just realized today we started this new probiotic a couple weeks ago and now I wonder if it has had a part in causing the constipation because we’re at a loss for what is the cause, our baby used to poop fine. So now we’re switching back to the one we used to use (Biogaia) which is expensive but well worth it if it helps her digestive system.
customer_reviews.author: HB

customer_reviews.title: Works better than the more popular probiotics
customer_reviews.text: Since my daughter was born she had problems with spitting up, gas, and upset tummy. We have used Gerber Soothe for most of her life. I couldn't find any or order any recently and decided to give this a try. I was a little worried that the switch after 8 months would be a problem. It wasn't! This works so much better compared to Gerber Soothe. My daughter actually has normal movements every 1-2 days. I am so happy I have found this product. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Really works!
customer_reviews.text: Really helped my baby with gas. He have no complaints when I gave him these drops like he did for many other drops. also helping to regulate his bowel movements, he used to get constipated with almost every food. Until now even when I run out of the drops he continues to have a normal regular bowel movement. Also so relieved to know that it contain vitamin d and I did not have to give it to him separately.
customer_reviews.author: Anon0129

customer_reviews.title: A must!
customer_reviews.text: Infant probiotics were recommended to us by her pediatrician and I have to say it is become a huge game changer. I little girls been taken out for 2 months and I feel like there’s a difference every time I forget to give her them at night at first it was hard to give her the drops but now it’s getting easier and easier and I think she likes the taste now she’s a make a silly face anymore actually make sure that I have two bottles at all times because I’m not very observant don’t realize when I get really low until it’s a little too late .
customer_reviews.author: Terra

customer_reviews.title: Helped with straining
customer_reviews.text: Helped my 6 week old with his straining. He's not constipated (his poop is normal, not hard), but is straining for 3-4 days. I started giving it to him in his bottle (1oz as suggested) for 3 days and did not see any changes, not even gas. We then put the drops directly into his mouth. Not hard to do with a newborn. He makes a sour face, I tried it and it is kind of sour. We saw changes every 2 days! He was having normal bowels every other day and gas. He's not straining as much, either. We are also giving him Enfamil Gentlease, which made him gassier.
customer_reviews.author: Yrios

customer_reviews.title: Gave our daughter diarrhea
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this gave our 8 month old daughter bad diarrhea. She had been on a different probiotic drop but we decided to try this one, so not sure if it was the change in drops or what. Poor girl had really runny poops and got bad diaper rash. As soon as we stopped it the diarrhea stopped, so this is what we've figure must have been the cause. I tasted the drops when we stopped giving them to her and it was really gritty and pretty nasty tasting. Maybe it was bad? Honey mustard color and thick consistency when our other is relatively tasteless and more like an olive oil consistency. Definitely won't be getting this again.
customer_reviews.author: Rob J

customer_reviews.title: Miracle drops!
customer_reviews.text: My baby had really bad colics on a daily basis. Her Dr recommended probiotics and after further research I went with culturelle. These Drops have worked so Amazing! They’ve really helped with her colics! I am very consistent about the drops on a daily basis. She does make a funny face while tasting them but she doesn’t spit them out or anything. I’ve had no issues what so ever! I’d definitely recommend for any mommy out there looking for something to help their baby with colics.
customer_reviews.author: Glo

customer_reviews.title: Baby loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My son is 8 months old. Since starting daycare a few months ago, he has been battling colds and viruses off and on. His pediatrician recommended this brand specifically when we took antibiotics. We have continued using it since. He absolutely loves them! I personally think it tastes gross but whatever! As long as he likes them. The dropper is pretty easy to use and I give him 5 drops each evening while breastfeeding. But be careful around nosey dogs. Our beagle decided to eat the whole bottle one night while I was putting the baby to bed. Apparently she thought it tasted good too!
customer_reviews.author: Jrc85

customer_reviews.title: Must try for infants with gas pain!
customer_reviews.text: After planning on breast feeding once she was born, I was not prepared for not producing enough. After a couple of weeks on formula, she was in so much pain from being unable to pass gas. I tried so many types of formula, Similac, Earths Best, Plum Organics all different types (sensitive, total comfort) with none of them relieving her pain. I read an article on probiotics thought I'd give it a try. SOOO glad I did, within 2 days she was relieved of her pain and not fussing at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Received item with opened box and bottle
customer_reviews.text: It’s my first review on Amazon! I were super unsatisfied when I received the product and the box and bottle has been opened already! This is the drops for babies, who will give baby for this kind of opened bottle drops. The worst shopping experiences ever.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Wu

customer_reviews.title: Good product, but bad applied method
customer_reviews.text: It works well. But very clear about the usage, it said 5 drops, but this product is too thick to drop down...and some drops are small, some are big, so it's really not sure if the usage is correct, I think we always overdosed...And the tube is very hard to clean...But anyway, it's a good product, my baby has colic, but after take this, he is better and better. Just hope they will have better applying way.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: I did not give 5 stars because it’s not 30 servings/ 30 days worth of product- I would say it’s about 3 weeks worth at best. For this reason
customer_reviews.text: My son is 7 months old and his gut cannot tolerate soy or dairy, so I got this probiotic hoping this would help his sensitive gut and boost his immune system. He’s a very healthy kid, so I didn’t notice any difference, but I believe the product is doing what it claims to do. I did not give 5 stars because it’s not 30 servings/ 30 days worth of product- I would say it’s about 3 weeks worth at best. For this reason, I am going to switch to Mommy’s Bliss and give them a try due to the similar ratings, but huge difference in price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gave baby terrible gas pain
customer_reviews.text: May work great for other babies but even with one drop within an hour my baby was crying hysterically and writhing in gas pain. We tried 5 drops at first and it was horrid. Not wanting to blame the drops in case he was just having a bad day or had a virus etc. I waited 4 days, he was super happy. Gave one drop in a bottle of breastmilk and as I said, within an hour he was miserable.
customer_reviews.author: Bmc

customer_reviews.title: Expensive product, hopefully it works!
customer_reviews.text: It's probiotics... and administered to a baby. I couldn't tell you if it works. However, I can tell you my experience as the parent. The bottle is convenient and comes with a dropper that you keep in all the time. The downside is that the liquid turns the dropper yellow inside and looks a big gummy. I'm thinking keeping it in the bottle isn't the best, but honestly, where else would you put the dropper. Anyhow, the product is what we believe we need... and baby takes it just fine. Easy enough to give baby 5drops on a spoon or in food.
customer_reviews.author: iRenaissanceMan

customer_reviews.title: I'd pay a pound of flesh for this stuff.
customer_reviews.text: I changed my baby's diaper and then began to burp him only to realize a while later that I had only unsnapped his onesie and hasn't changed him at all. Gas has allowed us both probably 8 hours of sleep in the past three days and you bet it's the most fun I've ever had. That "fun" instantly, and I mean *instantly* came to a halt once I gave him these drops. The kid is sleep, people. Now, time to wash the dishes.
customer_reviews.author: Son&Sky

customer_reviews.title: Look at the photos before you buy, it looks gross
customer_reviews.text: I bought this when my baby had to take antibiotics. The pediatrician said it was ok to use yogurt as well. But for babies who have sensitivity to cow's milk protein, yogurt is not an option. There are lots of user photos of what this product looks like. I wish I had looked at them before purchasing. The white gooey drops looks really gross. It says to use 5 drops per day but I only used one per day. Because it looked so gross to me. And I stopped as soon as the babe was done with antibiotics.
customer_reviews.author: GW

customer_reviews.title: Use with ⚠️
customer_reviews.text: My baby is 3 months old and she's struggled with gas since she was born. I tried mommy's bliss probiotic and they made her gassy for a day, then regulated her bowels and passed gas with ease. They worked wonderfully. These Culturelle drops made her so gassy and bloated for a whole week(the box warns of this for a 'couple days'.). I wanted to give them a fair chance since they're made with DHA. She was shrieking with pain, even more so than normal without the introduction of probiotics. I couldn't give them to her anymore knowing it was going to put her into direct pain. Right to the trash bin they go.
customer_reviews.author: Savannah

customer_reviews.title: Oily drops won’t wash out of bottles?
customer_reviews.text: I bought these probiotic drops to replace another brand I was giving my baby, as the price had gone up. My issue with these drops is that they are so greasy. I put them in my baby’s bottles, and I now can’t get the bottles clean. The bottle and the straw insert (Dr. Browns) are so greasy/oily that it won’t even come off in the dishwasher. This was not an issue with the other drops.
customer_reviews.author: Aratay

customer_reviews.title: Caused constipation.
customer_reviews.text: These caused constipation for my infant daughter! I gave them to her for a week, she pooped one day out of that week (she normally does daily). I stopped them and she went back to normal. My doctor was not convinced it was the drops so about a month later I started them back for another week. She did not poop that entire week. I completely stopped giving them to her and she went back to normal. Won’t be trying again.
customer_reviews.author: C.S.

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: Flavor is horrible. Child won't eat it so cant really review it. I tried one and it instantly turned into a thick paste in my mouth. It was like where is the nearest sink so I can spit out this horrible tasing probiotic powder. Oh wait it won't just spit out I have to wash it out cause its so thick. Ya dont buy these..... it won't even make it to your gut to help you poop better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Discoloration
customer_reviews.text: After a couple of uses, the liquid that remains in the dropper became thick, dry, and discolored (orangy color, instead of yellow when we first opened bottle). Considering that I am using this for the purpose of helping my newborn with her gastro issues, I do not feel comfortable feeding her something that changes consistency overtime. Direction states to use 5 drops, but once the consistency changes, we can no longer use the dropper for proper dosage. Will not purchase this again.
customer_reviews.author: sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Exclusively breast milk fed baby hates the taste
customer_reviews.text: My baby hates the taste when I put the drops direcly into her mouth. I breastfeed and also pump and feed her breastmilk in bottles. I tried mixing the drops with breastmilk in a bottle but the product sticks to the side of the bottle and inside the nipple so I don’t think she gets any of it. Not sure how else I can try to get her to take these.
customer_reviews.author: LYNDSAY

customer_reviews.title: Dosing a little tricky
customer_reviews.text: The only problem I have with this is the dosing. It has a dropper in the bottle but the drops are pretty thick. You’re supposed to drop 5 drops into baby’s mouth and that’s almost impossible. If you just squirt the whole thing in their mouth, the bottle doesn’t last 30 days, which means you’re overdoing it on dosage. I just wish there was an easier way
customer_reviews.author: Katie Ford

customer_reviews.title: If your baby has tummy issues GET THESE DROPS!
customer_reviews.text: My, my, I cannot say enough good things about these drops. My 5 month old breastfed baby has had tummy issues since day 1. Even after trying different things I could not figure out what I could do to help him. Until now. I started him on these drops once in morning, and seriously within a few days I could already tell the difference in how he is feeling. He is less gassy, less fussy, and can actually poop now. I am so, so thankful for this product. Thank you so much!!!
customer_reviews.author: James Goshow

customer_reviews.title: How much and what is actually in the bottle?
customer_reviews.text: I have bought this twice. I have twins and give them both the 5 drops a day, so 10 drops a day. It lasts 19 days. There also seems to be residue left in the bottle when it’s empty, I can only assume that’s vitamins my children haven’t gotten. I shake it every time before use. The bottle is tinted so I can’t even see how much is in it New, I don’t think they fill it. This product is a joke. Would rather buy the vitamins and probiotic separately, then I at least know what I’m getting.
customer_reviews.author: Alyce dentan

customer_reviews.title: Tummy Trouble Saver
customer_reviews.text: This probiotic is a sick baby saver. Unfortunately our baby got his first ear infection and was subject to antibiotics. In order to prevent him have adverse side effects to the medication like diarrhea our pediatrician recommended being proactive and using a probiotic. Thank goodness we did because he was feeling better in no time and did not have any tummy troubles.
customer_reviews.author: Jacquelyne

customer_reviews.title: Does help a two month old baby’s tummy and its gentle.
customer_reviews.text: It really helped my baby tummy. I’m a breast feeding mom and nothing that I took out of my diet was helping soothe her little tummy. But five drops a day four a week really helped with her tummy.
customer_reviews.author: Flo

customer_reviews.title: Love this 2 in 1
customer_reviews.text: This is such a great idea. After my first baby having colic, baby number two immediately went on a probiotic. However, he also needed vitamin D, as he is breastfed. Combining the two makes it so easy! The only negative is that it doesn't mix with breast milk and sometimes sticks to the side of bottles and nipples sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: Roslyn

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend
customer_reviews.text: Will not be buying again. The formulation of this is extremely thick making it difficult to get a good drop to give baby. It was also yellow and smelled funky when its supposed to be colorless and odorless. Should have spent the dollar more to get a better brand. The expiration date isn't until 2020 so it's not expired.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: Taste nasty no wonder my baby dislikes. You get almost nothing for what you pay for. 5 drops a day, this doesn’t last long. It has a Dropper but it doesn’t work well, the material gets stuck inside and hardens. It also changed color quickly .. would not repurchase
customer_reviews.author: Pahder E

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend, poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought a few just to see if the dropped would improve and it doesn’t. The design for the dropper is so bad that a lot is wasted and it’s not easy to dispense. I would NOT recommend it. The poor quality of the dropper also has me concerned because it leaks air which could mean bacteria could get in it. Not a fan of this product at all.
customer_reviews.author: Misty Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this a few months ago and just now opened it up.... I'm definitely not giving this to my baby.
customer_reviews.author: lynsey

customer_reviews.title: Box in rough shape, possible salmonella poisoning
customer_reviews.text: Unboxed this on Wednesday, gave a dose on Wednesday and Thursday. My one year old contracted Salmonella poisoning early Friday afternoon. Not 100% sure it came from this, but considering she eats what my family of 5 eats and no one else was sick, I'm backtracking as to what else it may be.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Good product, poor design.
customer_reviews.text: The probiotics worked well for my little sweetie but my issue is with the design of the product. It comes with a dropper, which at first seemed nice until I realized how much product was wasted with the dropper. As expensive as these are, every drop counts! I ended up purchasing the Gerber Soothe probiotics which has a different bottle design and it worked better for me.
customer_reviews.author: MorgansMom7348

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful- highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: My little guy used to SCREAM after feedings because he could not burp. After two months of using these drops (heck after one night), our baby is a completely different baby! He burps easily and has almost zero issues with gas now.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Baby Calm
customer_reviews.text: Our grandson had a slight case of colic and someone recommended this syrup for him and boy does it work. Give it to him around 730 at night and calms him enough that he sleeps well - he has some digestive issues also and this calms his stomach - I would recommend this
customer_reviews.author: Noel Tullis

customer_reviews.title: Sensitive formula and this=magic
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this stuff. For months she started waking up in the middle of the night screaming crying from gas and we didn’t know what to do. So her pediatrician recommended sensitive formula and it helped a lot but not fully so we added some of these and she hasn’t woken up at night from gas since. I only wish I knew about this earlier
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Definitely not for all babies
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my infant as the pediatrician said she needs viatmin d drops and I had already been using Gerber colic calm. I wanted a 2 in 1. This is very gritty and thick (yellow in color) even after shaking and mixing it as I would a vial for an injection. My daughter hated the taste. She became severely constipated and gassy. This in turn caused her to be uncomfortable and fussy. It also caused her to spit up worse than she ever has before. Not all babies are the same and Iknow this works for some babies, just not my baby.
customer_reviews.author: Jayme Bujdos

customer_reviews.title: She’s the gassiest she’s ever been
customer_reviews.text: We got these when we decided to go dairy free, since my baby might have a dairy allergy. The UpSpring ones we have are dairy, but we’re working super well. We switched to these and she is up all night with awful gas. :( we gave it time to see if it’d get better but after probably about a week, it’s only getting worse. She’s miserably gassy, we’re exhausted. These do not work for her.
customer_reviews.author: Kav&Tay

customer_reviews.title: Too oily , bad dropper
customer_reviews.text: The dropper is hard to use and the stuff sticks to everything (bottles and nipples) and is really hard to clean off. It doesn’t mix well because it’s so oily so I feel like most of it is still in the bottle stuck to the sides and not in my baby
customer_reviews.author: Jessie

customer_reviews.title: More Gassy and Fussy
customer_reviews.text: Every time I’ve given this to my infant, she keeps me up longer at night and is more gassy and unhappy. I gave up giving it to her. It’s also very oily and tastes terrible. I tried mixing it in her bottle once and it even left an oily residue. Glad it helps some. Just didn’t help my little one.
customer_reviews.author: ajulie4u

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my baby regular
customer_reviews.text: Not only is this a great Vitamin D product for your baby if it is needed, the probiotic is great and has really helped to keep my baby regular. If it's been a few days since he's gone to the bathroom, a dose of this probiotic and he is going the next day without fail. He doesn't seem to really mind the taste either. The color and smell is a little odd but that's about it.
customer_reviews.author: Alaina

customer_reviews.title: Is it really culturelle?
customer_reviews.text: This is my second time purchasing this product from Amazon. The first one worked great and everything was good. I haven't tried this bottle long enough to comment on the quality but the dropper (unopened) came squished and without a line that indicates how much I should dispense each time. I'm starting to feel uneasy about purchasing baby food and drug products on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Mina

customer_reviews.title: The liquid gets stuck to the dropper and the bottle and it feels like a lot is wasted
customer_reviews.text: I don't think I actually got 30 days of use out of this product. The liquid gets stuck to the dropper and the bottle and it feels like a lot is wasted. It tastes like yeast (I tasted it) and does have a strong flavor in my opinion. My son makes a weird face but takes it without a problem. I think I'm going to switch back to the biogaia drops even though they're more expensive .
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: AWEFUL PRODUCT! DO NOT BUY!! It’s weird color and consistency makes me think it’s expired even though the date is fine. Probably spoiled due to the fact the spout part comes apart from the actual bottle leaving the inside exposed so it’s never sealed. TERRIBLE AND WILL PROBABLY HARM MY BABY! Very disappointed and want my $$ back but of course window to return has closed. Seller please contact me wish I could give zero stars
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: baby like it
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty happy with this product my little girl seems to really like the taste I like that it comes with a built-in dropper and in a glass bottle the formula is really thick but I guess that's OK she doesn't struggle with it I would say the bottle itself is tiny I thought there would've been more in the bottle the packaging is adorable I love the green and blue and yellow especially the yellow I would recommend this seller other new mommies.
customer_reviews.author: vivian

customer_reviews.title: Disgusting!
customer_reviews.text: This thick, yellow goo should never be attempted to be measured via dropper into an infant's mouth. Totally impossible. To make matters worse, he was making a terrible face and thrashing away from me every time I tried. My husband finally ended up tasting some of it. He almost vomited and says it tastes like the worst gravy you could imagine. I'm throwing the rest away. Such a ridiculous waste of money. I'm disappointed, as I use Culturelle products myself and really had high hopes for this one.
customer_reviews.author: Kristal

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't Repurchase
customer_reviews.text: Not my favorite infant probiotic so far. It's a lot thicker than the previous brand I tried, my baby doesn't seem thrilled with the consistency. The thing I like least about it is that there are no markings at all on the dropper indicating 1 drop or 5 drops (the recommend amount). Seems too likely that baby will be getting too much or too little of this product. I do like that the Vitamin D is mixed in so I don't have to give baby 2 separate "medicines".
customer_reviews.author: Mcjohnson11

customer_reviews.title: Good intentions
customer_reviews.text: I liked the idea of having my baby's probiotic and vitamin D in the same bottle, so I gave this a try. I wasn't really pleased. I'm not sure what caused this, but my son would throw up after getting his daily dose. Chose a new brand and kept the probiotic and vitamin D separate, and he hasn't had any issues since.
customer_reviews.author: Karabella Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Makes an unpleasant situation bearable!
customer_reviews.text: I am being treated with an extremely heavy and prolonged dose of antibiotics -- I've been using this daily and after 5 weeks of antibiotics I have had no GI upsets or other secondary infections often associated with antibiotics. I'm so glad a friend recommended this!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin L Phelps

customer_reviews.title: The only product on the market that has both probiotics and vitamin D!
customer_reviews.text: Amazon has the cheapest price for this product! I’ve been using this since my daughter was 12 weeks old and she’s almost a year now! It definitely helps with constipation and the added bonus of vitamin D means I don’t need two separate things! We’re moving up to the 12 month product next month. Highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Smalz

customer_reviews.title: The bottle is very tiny. There are no accurate ...
customer_reviews.text: The bottle is very tiny. There are no accurate measurements , no guide, as to how much. I had to call and ask and they said squeeze the dropper full then only drop one in mouth with only squeezing once. Very misleading. Kind of scary you don't want to give your baby too much. Way overpriced. Didn't seem to make a difference with my 7 month old daughter
customer_reviews.author: ReviewFanatic4

customer_reviews.title: Taste waxy but newborn don't that reject it
customer_reviews.text: Deeeeeegusting but my newborn goes to town with it and don't spit it out. It does taste waxy to me. I honestly don't kno if it help or not the probiotic but he's getting the vitamin D. At least it doesn't smell as awful as Enfamil. I just wish I can utilize the coupons on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Lid keeps breaking before we’re halfway done with the bottle!
customer_reviews.text: My rating is not on the efficacy of the product but on the horrible packaging. I’m on my second bottle and both bottles the dropper/lid broke within 2 weeks. I had to throw the bottles half full out because I don’t have another lid or dropper that fits. They wouldn’t give us a refund unless we returned the item but I had already thrown away the bottle that was leaking everywhere so waste of money there! We’ll be ordering a different brand next time.
customer_reviews.author: MattWeber

customer_reviews.title: Too thick
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this for a few weeks and find it not effective, or at least not from what my 2month old is showing. Consistency is too thick. Not sure how she likes the taste since she keeps spitting it out and making faces. The product is quite pricey for the amount, it didn’t last too long. Wouldn’t buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Ichi Ban

customer_reviews.title: Gave baby bloat and gas
customer_reviews.text: Do not recommend. This was mistaken for colic! My baby screamed and screamed for hours. Doctor said it was colic and we have to “wait it out” ... as soon as I stopped giving him these drops ... he stopped screaming.
customer_reviews.author: SGT. C

customer_reviews.title: Combination product
customer_reviews.text: You only have to use 5 drops of this a day. Which is great when you have a little baby and you dont want to put a large amount of liquid in their mouth. This is probiotic and vitamin D which is great. He had tummy troubles from birth but since we have been using this his tummy issues have calmed down tremendously. Definately recommend these they are fantastic to have
customer_reviews.author: Boogjam

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: 5 Drops? What is that? The dropper is painfully difficult to use at best and impossible to clean. I can't believe the price on this product and the positive reviews. I am incredibly unhappy with this and it has already been thrown away.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality product
customer_reviews.text: Great quality product. I love the fact that it is a combination of probiotics and Vitamin D -- kills 2 birds with one stone. My baby always hates the taste of her Vitamin D. With this Culturelle baby product, I don't need to worry about her spitting up her formula like a Vitamin D because it doesn't really have a taste. Only 5 drops each time and the dropper is very easy to use. My baby gets both the probiotics and the Vitamin D which are critically important to her healthy growth and I am a happy mom.
customer_reviews.author: Fantastic Mom

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: This garbage makes my baby projectile vomit EVERY time no matter how I try to give it to him. I will be switching back to the Gerber Soothe probiotics.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sticks to bottles
customer_reviews.text: It says you can add this to their bottle but I have found it just sticks to the side of the bottle and is still there after running it through the dishwasher. I worry my son isn’t getting the recommended 5 drops. If you plan to just drop this in their mouth it’s fine (although difficult to measure/count drops when done this way.
customer_reviews.author: James Faherty

customer_reviews.title: Nightmare
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure this product works well for some kids, but my 6-month-old had the WORST night after I gave this to her. She was up with painful gas, screaming, crying all night. It was absolutely horrible. I know there's an "adjustment" period, but this was too much to EVER try again.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Good for tummy issues
customer_reviews.text: This product helped my baby’s tummy issues within 2-3 days of usage. He was super gassy/fussy and his pains seemingly went away when we mixed this into his morning bottle. We’ve been using daily for the last 4 months and am a big fan.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: I guess I gave a four star on the flavor was only because my child doesn’t like the taste. A little oily. But the product is worth its price. My baby is a gassy baby and doesn’t digest very well ,have tried all kinds of gas relief product and doesn’t help, but after using this she’s not that fussy anymore. This is the second one I’ve started to use
customer_reviews.author: pepper&mint

customer_reviews.title: Need better instructions on administering, and/or better dropper
customer_reviews.text: Felt like I was introducing bacteria to the bottle after administering to my infant. I tried my best not to touch my baby's mouth while administering, but the dropper made it very difficult. I tried cleaning the dropper, but that did not work as the probiotic is very thick. I stopped administering and feel like I wasted $20... very disappointed. Didn't see any improvement in the short time frame I used it. Also, box arrived damage, but I could tell it wasn't open.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Harding

customer_reviews.title: No dropper lid // easy to spill
customer_reviews.text: The box came crushed and the actual bottle didn’t have a dropper top/lid like every other oil or medicine that you measure by drops so it’s almost a free for all. I’ve wasted a lot already just for the fact there’s no way to control the flow. Real disappointed especially for price. Won’t be buying again.
customer_reviews.author: Amber havron

customer_reviews.title: Expired product
customer_reviews.text: I just received my new box. When I opened it I pulled the pamphlet out and noticed the coupon inside expired in 2018, it’s 2020. So I looked for the expiration date and it expired in March of this year. I get that yeah the manufacturer is now paying attention to coupon expiration dates but I should not receive a product that is expired.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My 19 month old doesn't even know the difference
customer_reviews.text: I mix this powder with my child's milk everyday. He's never been a child to not drink medicine or make a huge fuss about not liking something, but if he doesn't like it, he would lmk and put the item on the side. This product mixes well with whatever liquid you are using and seriously, you wouldn't even know it is in there! I have this item on a monthly subscription.
customer_reviews.author: Bri

customer_reviews.title: To many additives
customer_reviews.text: Made my kid very sick, wasted money on it had to stick with organic brand with less additives
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Her daughter wasn't feeling good. My niece said she was having belly problems
customer_reviews.text: My niece came and visited with her daughter Taylor. Her daughter wasn't feeling good. My niece said she was having belly problems. I suggested using baby calm + comfort probiotics by Cultrelle. With doctors approval my niece put it in her bottle. Like magic Taylor was all smiles feeling a lot better. Happy mom, Happy baby. I give it all thumbs up....
customer_reviews.author: evelyn

customer_reviews.title: Magic in a bottle!!
customer_reviews.text: This was magical for our little one! I believe she was colicky. Cried for hours every night. Then I bought this..within 24 to 48 hours, the crying stopped...and we actually slept!!! Very tiny bottle for the price, but oh so worth it!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Probiotic, annoying bottle
customer_reviews.text: This product has really helped with my baby's colic/gas/reflux. I love that the vitamin D is already in it, so it's one less thing to remember. The only negative I have is the packaging and dropper. It's impossible not to get the product all over the outside of the bottle, and it tends to crust up around the lid.
customer_reviews.author: butrfly

customer_reviews.title: Too thick
customer_reviews.text: I didn't like using this product. It is too thick which makes it difficult to administer. The droppler gets really sticky and gooey after only couple of uses and it is recommended to not to clean it.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Z

customer_reviews.title: RN loves this
customer_reviews.text: Love the product labeling and design. What I love is that it is a pre and probiotic product. It is hard finding pre & probiotic products for a baby that are two in one. My baby drinks Holle formula and I wanted to chose a good quality product to go with his formula. There is no refrigeration required, which I think is awesome. Pretty great price too. My baby has done well so far and it regulates him with his bowel movements. He has gone one full year without being sick! I trust this stuff and plan to use it with my other baby on the way.
customer_reviews.author: JIMMY FLOYD

customer_reviews.title: I’d recommend trying this!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. 3mo baby doesn’t taste it in bottles with breastmilk and takes it at times alone (on pacifier). Also I’ve noticed a difference in his movements for the better so giving this to him once a day. I would recommend trying if your little one isn’t too regular or makes a bright red face when going poop. Good luck!
customer_reviews.author: Cristina

customer_reviews.title: Wish I found this when I gave birth to my oldest!
customer_reviews.text: Been using this since birth for my 10 week old baby. We can always tell if we miss a day! He is so fussy without. This has helped him handle his gas so much. We made the mistake of forgetting it on an overnight trip, won't do it again. The first thing we pack!
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Easy to overdose.
customer_reviews.text: The dropper doesn't work well.. Easy to over dose. It takes a bit used to to hold a baby (sometimes crying) and administering the medicine through the dropper. The medicine itself is not that smooth.. it's a bit grainy.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Moving on.
customer_reviews.text: To be honest, I thought I would love this product for my newborn. I have two older kids and get the culturelle probiotic and multi chewables for them and we love them! This product, sadly, tastes horrendous, is hard to do five “drops” in an infants mouth, and doesn’t have much quantity for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Begger

customer_reviews.title: Thick consistency
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used a different brand prior, this was more affordable. Not only did the color of it not look to appealing but the consistency as well. A lot thicker and tint of yellow. It also really bothers my sons stomach but ofcourse all babies are different.
customer_reviews.author: jacjac23

customer_reviews.title: Recommended by Pediatric GI Specialist
customer_reviews.text: This helped my twins with some GI allergy issues they were having. I put it straight into their bottles every evening. This was the brand recommended to us by our GI Specialist. My girls never showed any aversion to it and it helped regulate their bowels.
customer_reviews.author: Twincess Mama

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product! I work in a dietary supplement industry- have an extensive knowledge about the benefits of probiotics. My 6 month old son was having diarrhea and I started giving this to him. The next day diarrhea was gone. I love that it contains Vit D in it as well. We give this to my son every day. I think it really helps with all the new solid foods he has been trying.
customer_reviews.author: Anastasiya

customer_reviews.title: Best Probiotic/Vitamin D for Baby
customer_reviews.text: This is pricier than the rest BUT it is worth it because of the droplet dispenser. All the other Vitamin D drops for baby come with an annoying dropper built into the bottle and it can take FOREVER for the drops to come out- not something you want to deal with when you have a screaming child.
customer_reviews.author: Kir die Bear

customer_reviews.title: Need
customer_reviews.text: I need this to help my baby. He is suffer from the gas problem. I am not quite sure if it is working,but things getting better now!the only thing is tooooo little....eat so fast,compare with this,it seems expansive.
customer_reviews.author: ying

customer_reviews.title: Seems just fine. Baby not colicky so no comment there.
customer_reviews.text: I think these were fine. He had a little diarrhea and we got these just in case. He took them easily so the taste must not have bothered him. Made his poop smell like yogurt!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Lin

customer_reviews.title: Baby diarrhea
customer_reviews.text: Baby got diarrhea after first dosage. Stopped using and baby has gone back to having normal bowel movements. We will instead be using vitamin d only drops, they are cheaper and don’t give the baby diarrhea.
customer_reviews.author: Justanotheramazoncustomer

customer_reviews.title: Do not work, may be even worse
customer_reviews.text: I don't know others. But it does not work for my baby who is two months old. 1. She keeps crying and even more after she uses the probiotic. 2. She can drink it, which means the flavor is Ok.
customer_reviews.author: Jack See

product_meta.title: Culturelle Baby Calm + Comfort Probiotics + Chamomile Drops | Helps Reduce Occasional Infant Digestive Upset, 0.29 fl. oz. Drops
product_meta.description: Style:Calm & Comfort Drops with ChamomileHelp reduce your baby’s fussiness and crying due to occasional digestive upset with easy-to-use probiotic drops* As a parent, an inconsolable infant can leave you feeling helpless. Too often, tummy troubles are the source of this occasional distress. Probiotic drops, like Culturelle Baby Calm + Comfort Probiotic + Chamomile Drops, help support baby’s health by boosting digestion, alleviating occasional digestive upset, and reducing the associated fussiness and crying to help put your baby—and you—at ease.* Developing a healthy microbiome, immune system and digestive health is important for baby. What makes Culturelle Baby Calm + Comfort the best choice? The most clinically studied probiotic in infants, Lactobacillus rhamnosus GG, helps restore the natural balance of good bacteria in your baby’s digestive tract to help reduce occasional digestive upset which is a common cause of fussiness and crying.*Looking for a probiotic supplement with Vitamin D? Try Baby Grow + Thrive, a daily probiotic supplement that delivers recommended amount of Vitamin D (the American Academy of Pediatrics recommends infants supplement with 400 IU (10mcg) of vitamin D), to help support baby’s healthy development.* Culturelle formulates probiotic supplements specifically for babies 0-12 months, babies and toddlers 12-24 months, and kids 1 year and up. Explore products that are best for your kids below or by visiting Culturelle Clubhouse on our website.
feature_bullets: HELPS YOU SOOTHE YOUR BABY with a safe and gentle probiotic strain that works naturally to help reduce fussiness and crying due to occasional digestive upset
THE MOST CLINICALLY STUDIED PROBIOTIC IN INFANTS, Lactobacillus rhamnosus GG, helps restore the natural balance of good bacteria in your baby’s digestive tract*
HELPS BOOST DIGESTION*: Culturelle Baby Calm & Comfort Probiotic Plus Chamomile Drops helps support baby’s health by boosting digestion*.
SAFE AND GENTLE, with chamomile extract. Dairy free, Gluten Free, and Sugar Free. Once opened, use within 60 days

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
